subject: Mental Health
title: Single-Incident Trauma
description: A fast breakdown of Single-Incident Trauma for builders.

hook.text: One car crash, one assault, one earthquake â€” a single event can fracture a life.

buildup.text: Single-incident trauma, or Type I, occurs from one overwhelming event.

discovery.text: The brain stores the event with vivid, intrusive detail because of the shock.

twist.text: Many people recover naturally within weeks. About 20 percent develop lasting PTSD.

climax.text: Early support in the first days dramatically reduces the chance of chronic symptoms.

punchline.text: One moment can echo for years â€” or heal in weeks.
